The Problem

Those experiencing homelessness are more exposed to chronic illness, injuries, suicidal ideation and violence than others.

>2,000 People

Every night, more than 2,000 people in the greater Kansas City area sleep on the streets, in their carss, or in homeless encampments.

8,471 Students

An estimated 8,471 public school students experienced homelessness in recent years.

47 Years Old

The average life expectancy of a U.S. citizen is 79 years old, but for a person experiencing homelessness, that number drops to just 47 years old.

We work to provide the most vulnerable populations in Kansas City with access to quality holistic health care and social services.
